When they pass a hundred years, their life span decreases by ten years.
Another hundred years will decrease by ten years.
It gradually decreases in order until the remaining ten years.
The last ten years of his life won't be further reduced.
It's as long as 80,000 years and as short as 10 years.
That's the sequence if the Buddha doesn't appear in the world.
If the Buddha were to appear in the world and abide according to the true teaching.
The life of sentient beings remains transient and doesn't decrease.
As the right Dharma decreases slightly, their life span gradually decreases.
The Buddha, the Bhagavān, says this is what I've heard.
Lishiapitan lun, vol. 9
